metachat.tl.summary_pathway

metachat.tl.summary_pathway(adata, database_name=None, group_name=None, sender_group=None, receiver_group=None, usenumber_metapathway=5, permutation_spatial=False)[source]

Function for summarizng MCC pathway pattern given specific sender group and receiver group.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – The data matrix of shape n_obs × n_var. Rows correspond to cells or spots and columns to genes.

  • database_name (Optional[str]) – Name of the Metabolite-Sensor interaction database.

  • group_name (Optional[str]) – Group name of the cell annotation previously saved in adata.obs.

  • sender_group (Optional[str]) – Name of the sender group

  • receiver_group (Optional[str]) – Name of the receiver group

  • usenumber_metapathway (int) – Number of top metabolic pathways to use in the summary. Default is 5.

  • permutation_spatial (bool) – Whether to use results from mc.tl.communication_group_spatial.

Returns:

  • metapathway_rank (pd.DataFrame) – Ranking of metabolic pathways.

  • senspathway_rank (pd.DataFrame) – Ranking of sensor’s pathways.

  • ms_result (pd.DataFrame) – The data frame of communication intensity between meatbolic pathway and sensor pathway.
